posts.name: Big Apple Inn
posts.note: The Big Apple Inn is an institution of old-school Southern sandwiches from Jackson, MS, which have 'smokes' (sausage), 'ears' (pig ears), and tamales along with a whole lot of history and hospitality. The sausage sandwich and the pig sandwich were great and one of the best things I ate on my 13-day tour of the south. NOTE: They have multiple locations.
posts.rcmmnd: Anthony Bourdain and John T Edge

posts.name: Bully’s Restaurant
posts.note: Bully’s Restaurant is a venerable, unpretentious eatery dishing out soul food such as beef ribs, fried chicken, and catfish. Make sure to get yourself some greens. Recommended by John T. Edge.

posts.name: Mayflower Cafe
posts.note: Mayflower Cafe is a landmark eatery dating to 1935 featuring Greek-inspired seafood and steak dishes in retro digs. The Mayflower began as a hamburger stand, started by a pair of Greek immigrants and friends from the deeply-Orthodox island of Patmos.
